decks.notes: This aggressive deck utilizes Satya, Aetherflux Genius as the commander to overwhelm opponents with a versatile array of low-cost spells and creatures. By combining efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares with disruptive counterspells like Mana Leak and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to control the board while steadily chipping away at the opponent's life total. With powerful flying creatures like Aven Mindcensor and Brazen Borrower, as well as tempo plays from cards like Remand and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck can quickly establish dominance on the battlefield. By maintaining pressure and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to close out the game swiftly and decisively.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with Deadpool as the commander, utilizing a range of low-cost creatures and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Boggart Trawler and Broadside Bombardiers, along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes powerful cards like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to maintain pressure on the opponent. With a strong mana base including cards like Blood Crypt and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This aggressive deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells and efficient creatures to control the board and deal damage quickly. With a mix of hand disruption, removal, and powerful creatures, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. Kefka, Court Mage serves as the commander, providing card advantage and flexibility. The deck includes a variety of instant and sorcery spells for removal and disruption, along with strong creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Vendilion Clique. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to cast its spells efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain control of the game through disruption and aggression.

This deck focuses on a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing the partner commanders Ravos, Soultender and Thrasios, Triton Hero, the deck can maintain card advantage and flexibility in its game plan. With a strong mana base and access to cards like Birthing Pod, Eldritch Evolution, and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck can consistently put pressure on the opponent and disrupt their plans. The inclusion of cards like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize allows for interaction with the opponent's strategy, while cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Skullclamp provide additional value and card draw. Overall, this deck aims to be proactive and efficient in its game plan, aiming to win through combat damage or overwhelming board presence.

This deck revolves around using various combo pieces and disruption spells to control the game and set up a powerful win condition with Acererak the Archlich. The main goal is to assemble the necessary cards to generate a large amount of mana with cards like Cabal Coffers and Bubbling Muck, while using spells like Dark Petition and Demonic Tutor to find key combo pieces. The deck also includes a range of removal and hand disruption spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By carefully managing resources and timing, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish using cards like Tendrils of Agony or Necropotence.

The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with cards like Exploration and Azusa, Lost but Seeking to get ahead on mana. It then uses control elements like Maze of Ith and Blast Zone to disrupt opponent's strategies and stabilize the board. The deck also includes powerful utility lands like Gaea's Cradle and Eye of Ugin to generate value and find key threats like Primeval Titan and Emrakul. With a suite of tutor effects like Green Sun's Zenith and Worldly Tutor, the deck can find key pieces quickly to close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast mana acceleration and efficient threats while controlling the board to secure victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies with Juri, Master of the Revue as the commander, utilizing a wide range of powerful creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Bloodsoaked Champion and Carrion Feeder, as well as impactful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push. Additionally, there are powerful synergies such as Goblin Bombardment and Gravecrawler, allowing for recurring threats and additional reach. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the aggressive game plan, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and win the game through combat damage as quickly as possible.

This deck focuses on aggressive play utilizing Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd as the commander. The deck includes a mix of creatures that can quickly put pressure on opponents while also disrupting their strategy with cards like Drannith Magistrate and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. It also includes powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Council's Judgment to deal with threats from the opponent. The deck aims to quickly establish board presence, protect key creatures with cards like Giver of Runes and Benevolent Bodyguard, and close out the game with powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and disruptive in order to secure a victory in a 1 vs 1 format.
